text: These are the words that Moses spoke to all Israel across the Jordan in the wilderness, in the Arabah opposite Suph, between Paran and Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Dizahab.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is eleven days’ journey from Horeb by way of Mount Seir to Kadesh-barnea.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the fortieth year, on the first day of the eleventh month, Moses spoke to the sons of Israel, in accordance with everything that the Lord had commanded him to declare to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: after he had defeated Sihon the king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, who lived in Ashtaroth and in Edrei.
speaker: Narrator

text: Across the Jordan in the land of Moab, Moses began to explain this Law, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Lord our God spoke to us at Horeb, saying, ‘You have stayed long enough at this mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn and set out on your journey, and go to the hill country of the Amorites, and to all their neighbors in the Arabah, in the hill country, in the lowland, in the Negev, by the seacoast, the land of the Canaanites, and Lebanon, as far as the great river, the river Euphrates.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, I have placed the land before you; go in and take possession of the land which the Lord swore to give to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, and their descendants after them.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “And I spoke to you at that time, saying, ‘I am not able to endure you alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord your God has multiplied you, and behold, you are this day like the stars of heaven in number.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord, the God of your fathers increase you a thousand times more than you are, and bless you, just as He has promised you!
speaker: Narrator

text: How can I alone endure the burden and weight of you and your strife?
speaker: Narrator

text: Obtain for yourselves men who are wise, discerning, and informed from your tribes, and I will appoint them as your heads.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And you answered me and said, ‘The thing which you have said to do is good.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So I took the heads of your tribes, wise and informed men, and appointed them as heads over you, commanders of thousands, hundreds, fifties, and tens, and officers for your tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then I ordered your judges at that time, saying, ‘Hear the cases between your fellow countrymen and judge righteously between a person and his fellow countryman, or the stranger who is with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are not to show partiality in judgment; you shall hear the small and the great alike. You are not to be afraid of any person, for the judgment is God’s. The case that is too difficult for you, you shall bring to me, and I will hear it.’
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time I commanded you all the things that you were to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then we set out from Horeb, and went through all that great and terrible wilderness that you saw on the way to the hill country of the Amorites, just as the Lord our God had commanded us; and we came to Kadesh-barnea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I said to you, ‘You have come to the hill country of the Amorites, which the Lord our God is about to give us.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, the Lord your God has placed the land before you; go up, take possession, just as the Lord, the God of your fathers, has spoken to you. Do not fear or be dismayed.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then all of you approached me and said, ‘Let us send men ahead of us, so that they may spy out the land for us, and bring back to us word of the way by which we should go up, and the cities which we should enter.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The plan pleased me, and I took twelve of your men, one man for each tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they turned and went up into the hill country, and came to the Valley of Eshcol, and spied it out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took some of the fruit of the land in their hands and brought it down to us. They also brought us back a report and said, ‘The land that the Lord our God is about to give us is good.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yet you were unwilling to go up; instead you rebelled against the command of the Lord your God;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you grumbled in your tents and said, ‘Because the Lord hates us, He has brought us out of the land of Egypt, to hand us over to the Amorites to destroy us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Where can we go up? Our brothers have made our hearts melt, by saying, “The people are bigger and taller than we; the cities are large and fortified up to heaven. And besides, we saw the sons of the Anakim there.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: But I said to you, ‘Do not be terrified, nor fear them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord your God, who goes before you, will Himself fight for you, just as He did for you in Egypt before your eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in the wilderness where you saw how the Lord your God carried you, just as a man carries his son, on all of the road which you have walked until you came to this place.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet in spite of all this, you did not trust the Lord your God,
speaker: Narrator

text: who goes before you on your way, to seek out a place for you to make camp, in the fire by night to show you the way by which you should go, and in the cloud by day.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then the Lord heard the sound of your words, and He was angry and swore an oath, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Not one of these men, this evil generation, shall see the good land which I swore to give your fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: except Caleb the son of Jephunneh; he shall see it, and to him I will give the land on which he has set foot, and to his sons, because he has followed the Lord fully.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord was angry with me also on your account, saying, ‘Not even you shall enter there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua the son of Nun, who stands before you, shall himself enter there; encourage him, for he will give it to Israel as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, your little ones who, you said, would become plunder, and your sons, who this day have no knowledge of good and evil, shall enter there, and I will give it to them and they shall take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, turn around and set out for the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then you replied to me, ‘We have sinned against the Lord; we ourselves will go up and fight, just as the Lord our God commanded us.’ And every man of you strapped on his weapons of war, and you viewed it as easy to go up into the hill country.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said to me, ‘Say to them, “Do not go up nor fight, for I am not among you; otherwise you will be defeated by your enemies.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: So I spoke to you, but you would not listen. Instead, you rebelled against the command of the Lord, and acted presumptuously and went up into the hill country.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Amorites who lived in that hill country came out against you and chased you as bees do, and they scattered you from Seir to Hormah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you returned and wept before the Lord; but the Lord did not listen to your voice, nor pay attention to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you remained at Kadesh for many days, the days that you spent there.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then we turned and set out for the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea, as the Lord spoke to me, and we circled Mount Seir for many days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You have circled this mountain long enough. Now turn north,
speaker: Narrator

text: and command the people, saying, “You are going to pass through the territory of your brothers the sons of Esau, who live in Seir; and they will be afraid of you. So be very careful;
speaker: Narrator

text: do not provoke them, for I will not give you any of their land, not even as much as a footprint, because I have given Mount Seir to Esau as a possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to buy food from them with money so that you may eat, and you shall also purchase water from them with money so that you may drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord your God has blessed you in all that you have done; He has known your wandering through this great wilderness. These forty years the Lord your God has been with you; you have not lacked anything.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: “So we passed beyond our brothers the sons of Esau, who live in Seir, away from the Arabah road, away from Elath and Ezion-geber. And we turned and passed through by the way of the wilderness of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to me, ‘Do not attack Moab, nor provoke them to war, for I will not give you any of their land as a possession, because I have given Ar to the sons of Lot as a possession.’
speaker: Narrator

text: (The Emim lived there previously, a people as great, numerous, and tall as the Anakim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Like the Anakim, they too are regarded as Rephaim, but the Moabites call them Emim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Horites previously lived in Seir, but the sons of Esau dispossessed them and destroyed them from before them, and settled in their place; just as Israel did to the land of their possession which the Lord gave them.)
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Now arise and cross over the Wadi Zered yourselves.’ So we crossed over the Wadi Zered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the time that it took for us to come from Kadesh-barnea until we crossed over the Wadi Zered was thirty-eight years, until all the generation of the men of war perished from within the camp, just as the Lord had sworn to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, the hand of the Lord was against them, to destroy them from within the camp until they all perished.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So it came about, when all the men of war had finally perished from among the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: that the Lord spoke to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Today you shall cross over Ar, the border of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you come opposite the sons of Ammon, do not attack them nor provoke them, for I will not give you any of the land of the sons of Ammon as a possession, because I have given it to the sons of Lot as a possession.’
speaker: Narrator

text: (It is also regarded as the land of the Rephaim, because the Rephaim previously lived in it, but the Ammonites call them Zamzummin,
speaker: Narrator

text: a people as great, numerous, and tall as the Anakim; but the Lord destroyed them before them. And they dispossessed them and settled in their place,
speaker: Narrator

text: just as He did for the sons of Esau, who live in Seir, when He destroyed the Horites from before them; they dispossessed them and settled in their place, where they remain even to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for the Avvim, who lived in villages as far as Gaza, the Caphtorim, who came from Caphtor, destroyed them and lived in their place.)
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Arise, set out, and pass through the Valley of Arnon. Look! I have handed over to you Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land; start taking possession and plunge into battle with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: This day I will begin to put the dread and fear of you upon the faces of people everywhere, who, when they hear the news of you, will tremble and be in anguish because of you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “So I sent messengers from the wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon king of Heshbon with words of peace, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Let me pass through your land; I will travel only on the road. I will not turn aside to the right or to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will sell me food for money so that I may eat, and give me water for money so that I may drink, only let me pass through on foot,
speaker: Narrator

text: just as the sons of Esau who live in Seir and the Moabites who live in Ar did for me, until I cross over the Jordan into the land that the Lord our God is giving us.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But Sihon king of Heshbon was not willing for us to pass through his land; for the Lord your God hardened his spirit and made his heart obstinate, in order to hand him over to you, as he is today.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to me, ‘See, I have begun to turn Sihon and his land over to you. Begin taking possession, so that you may possess his land.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then Sihon came out with all his people to meet us in battle at Jahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord our God turned him over to us, and we defeated him with his sons and all his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we captured all his cities at that time and utterly destroyed the men, women, and children of every city. We left no survivor.
speaker: Narrator

text: We took only the animals as our plunder, and the spoils of the cities which we had captured.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Aroer which is on the edge of the Valley of Arnon and from the city which is in the valley, even to Gilead, there was no city that was too high for us; the Lord our God turned it all over to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only you did not go near the land of the sons of Ammon, all along the river Jabbok and the cities of the hill country, and wherever the Lord our God had commanded us to avoid.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then we turned and went up the road to Bashan, and Og, king of Bashan, came out with all his people to meet us in battle at Edrei.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said to me, ‘Do not fear him, for I have handed him and all his people and his land over to you; and you shall do to him just as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord our God also handed over to us Og, king of Bashan, with all his people, and we struck them until no survivor was left.
speaker: Narrator

text: We captured all his cities at that time; there was not a city which we did not take from them: sixty cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were cities fortified with high walls, gates, and bars, besides a great many unwalled towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: We utterly destroyed them, as we did to Sihon king of Heshbon, utterly destroying the men, women, and children of every city.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all the animals and the spoils of the cities we took as our plunder.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So at that time we took the land from the hand of the two kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan, from the Valley of Arnon to Mount Hermon
speaker: Narrator

text: (Sidonians call Hermon Sirion, and the Amorites call it Senir):
speaker: Narrator

text: all the cities of the plateau, all Gilead, and all Bashan, as far as Salecah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For only Og king of Bashan was left of the remnant of the Rephaim. Behold, his bed was a bed of iron; it is in Rabbah of the sons of Ammon. Its length was nine cubits, and its width four cubits by the usual cubit.)
speaker: Narrator

text: “So we took possession of this land at that time. From Aroer, which is by the Valley of Arnon, and half the hill country of Gilead and its cities I gave to the Reubenites and to the Gadites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest of Gilead and all Bashan, the kingdom of Og, I gave to the half-tribe of Manasseh, all the region of Argob. (As to all Bashan, it is called the land of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jair the son of Manasseh took all the region of Argob as far as the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, that is, Bashan, and named it after his own name: Havvoth-jair, as it is to this day.)
speaker: Narrator

text: To Machir I gave Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Reubenites and the Gadites I gave from Gilead even as far as the Valley of Arnon, the middle of the valley as a border, and as far as the river Jabbok, the border of the sons of Ammon;
speaker: Narrator

text: the Arabah also, with the Jordan as a border, from Chinnereth even as far as the sea of the Arabah, the Salt Sea, at the foot of the slopes of Pisgah on the east.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then I commanded you at that time, saying, ‘The Lord your God has given you this land to possess it; all you valiant men shall cross over armed ahead of your brothers, the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, your wives, your little ones, and your livestock (I know that you have much livestock) shall remain in your cities which I have given you,
speaker: Narrator

text: until the Lord gives rest to your fellow countrymen as to you, and they also take possession of the land which the Lord your God is giving them beyond the Jordan. Then you may return, each man to his possession which I have given you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, ‘Your eyes have seen everything that the Lord your God has done to these two kings; the Lord will do the same to all the kingdoms into which you are about to cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not fear them, for the Lord your God is the One fighting for you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “I also pleaded with the Lord at that time, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Lord God, You have begun to show Your servant Your greatness and Your strong hand; for what god is there in heaven or on earth who can do such works and mighty acts as Yours?
speaker: Narrator

text: Please let me cross over and see the good land that is beyond the Jordan, that good hill country, and Lebanon.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord was angry with me on your account, and would not listen to me; instead, the Lord said to me, ‘Enough! Do not speak to Me any more about this matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go up to the top of Pisgah and raise your eyes to the west, the north, the south, and the east, and see it with your eyes; for you shall not cross over this Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: But commission Joshua and encourage him and strengthen him, for he shall go across leading this people, and he will give to them, as an inheritance, the land which you will see.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So we remained in the valley opposite Beth-peor.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now, Israel, listen to the statutes and the judgments which I am teaching you to perform, so that you will live and go in and take possession of the land which the Lord, the God of your fathers, is giving you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not add to the word which I am commanding you, nor take away from it, so that you may keep the commandments of the Lord your God which I am commanding you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your eyes have seen what the Lord has done in the case of Baal-peor, for all the men who followed Baal-peor, the Lord your God has destroyed them from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you who clung to the Lord your God are alive today, every one of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “See, I have taught you statutes and judgments just as the Lord my God commanded me, that you are to do these things in the land where you are entering to take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: So keep and do them, for that is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the peoples who will hear all these statutes and say, ‘Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For what great nation is there that has a god so near to it as is the Lord our God whenever we call on Him?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or what great nation is there that has statutes and judgments as righteous as this whole Law which I am setting before you today?
speaker: Narrator

text: “Only be careful for yourself and watch over your soul diligently, so that you do not forget the things which your eyes have seen and they do not depart from your heart all the days of your life; but make them known to your sons and your grandsons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the day you stood before the Lord your God at Horeb, when the Lord said to me, ‘Assemble the people to Me, that I may have them hear My words so that they may learn to fear Me all the days that they live on the earth, and that they may teach their children.’
speaker: Narrator

text: You came forward and stood at the foot of the mountain, and the mountain was burning with fire to the heart of the heavens: darkness, cloud, and thick gloom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord spoke to you from the midst of the fire; you heard the sound of words, but you saw no form—there was only a voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: So He declared to you His covenant which He commanded you to perform, that is, the Ten Commandments; and He wrote them on two tablets of stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and judgments, so that you would perform them in the land where you are going over to take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So be very careful yourselves, since you did not see any form on the day the Lord spoke to you at Horeb from the midst of the fire,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you do not act corruptly and make a carved image for yourselves in the form of any figure, a representation of male or female,
speaker: Narrator

text: a representation of any animal that is on the earth, a representation of any winged bird that flies in the sky,
speaker: Narrator

text: a representation of anything that crawls on the ground, or a representation of any fish that is in the water below the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And be careful not to raise your eyes to heaven and look at the sun, the moon, and the stars, all the heavenly lights, and allow yourself to be drawn away and worship them and serve them, things which the Lord your God has allotted to all the peoples under the whole heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord has taken you and brought you out of the iron furnace, from Egypt, to be a people of His own possession, as today.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now the Lord was angry with me on your account, and He swore that I would not cross the Jordan, and that I would not enter the good land which the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am going to die in this land; I am not crossing the Jordan, but you are going to cross, and you will take possession of this good land.
speaker: Narrator

text: So be careful yourselves, that you do not forget the covenant of the Lord your God which He made with you, and make for yourselves a carved image in the form of anything against which the Lord your God has commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord your God is a consuming fire, a jealous God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you father children and have grandchildren, and you grow old in the land, and you act corruptly, and make an idol in the form of anything, and do what is evil in the sight of the Lord your God to provoke Him to anger,
speaker: Narrator

text: I call heaven and earth as witnesses against you today, that you will certainly perish quickly from the land where you are going over the Jordan to take possession of it. You will not live long on it, but will be utterly destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will scatter you among the peoples, and you will be left few in number among the nations where the Lord drives you.
speaker: Narrator

text: There you will serve gods, the work of human hands, wood and stone, which neither see nor hear, nor eat nor smell anything.
speaker: Narrator

text: But from there you will seek the Lord your God, and you will find Him if you search for Him with all your heart and all your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you are in distress and all these things happen to you, in the latter days you will return to the Lord your God and listen to His voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord your God is a compassionate God; He will not abandon you nor destroy you, nor forget the covenant with your fathers which He swore to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Indeed, ask now about the earlier days that were before your time, since the day that God created mankind on the earth, and inquire from one end of the heavens to the other. Has anything been done like this great thing, or has anything been heard like it?
speaker: Narrator

text: Has any people heard the voice of God speaking from the midst of the fire, as you have heard it, and survived?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or has a god ventured to go to take for himself a nation from within another nation by trials, by signs and wonders, by war, by a mighty hand, by an outstretched arm, and by great terrors, just as the Lord your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
speaker: Narrator

text: You were shown these things so that you might know that the Lord, He is God; there is no other besides Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the heavens He let you hear His voice to discipline you; and on earth He let you see His great fire, and you heard His words from the midst of the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because He loved your fathers, He chose their descendants after them. And He personally brought you from Egypt by His great power,
speaker: Narrator

text: driving out from before you nations greater and mightier than you, to bring you in and to give you their land as an inheritance, as it is today.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore know today, and take it to your heart, that the Lord, He is God in heaven above and on the earth below; there is no other.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall keep His statutes and His commandments which I am giving you today, so that it may go well for you and for your children after you, and that you may live long on the land which the Lord your God is giving you for all time.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses set apart three cities across the Jordan to the east,
speaker: Narrator

text: for one to flee there who unintentionally killed his neighbor, without having hatred for him in time past; and by fleeing to one of these cities he might live:
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezer in the wilderness on the plateau for the Reubenites, Ramoth in Gilead for the Gadites, and Golan in Bashan for the Manassites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now this is the Law which Moses set before the sons of Israel;
speaker: Narrator

text: these are the testimonies and the statutes, and the ordinances which Moses spoke to the sons of Israel, when they came out of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: across the Jordan, in the valley opposite Beth-peor, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites who lived in Heshbon, whom Moses and the sons of Israel defeated when they came out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took possession of his land and the land of Og king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites, who were across the Jordan to the east,
speaker: Narrator

text: from Aroer, which is on the edge of the Valley of Arnon, even as far as Mount Sion (that is, Hermon),
speaker: Narrator

text: with all the Arabah across the Jordan to the east, even as far as the sea of the Arabah, at the foot of the slopes of Pisgah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now Moses summoned all Israel and said to them:
“Listen, Israel, to the statutes and ordinances which I am speaking today for you to hear, so that you may learn them and be careful to do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord our God made a covenant with us at Horeb.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord did not make this covenant with our fathers, but with us, all of us who are alive here today.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke with you face to face at the mountain from the midst of the fire,
speaker: Narrator

text: while I was standing between the Lord and you at that time, to declare to you the word of the Lord; for you were afraid because of the fire, and you did not go up on the mountain. He said,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I am the Lord your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You shall have no other gods besides Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You shall not make for yourself a carved image, or any likeness of what is in heaven above or on the earth beneath or in the water under the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not worship them nor serve them; for I, the Lord your God, am a jealous God, inflicting the punishment of the fathers on the children, even on the third and fourth generations of those who hate Me,
speaker: Narrator

text: but showing favor to thousands, to those who love Me and keep My commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain, for the Lord will not leave unpunished the one who takes His name in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Keep the Sabbath day to treat it as holy, as the Lord your God commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For six days you shall labor and do all your work,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the seventh day is a Sabbath of the Lord your God; you shall not do any work that day, you or your son or your daughter, or your male slave or your female slave, or your ox, your donkey, or any of your cattle, or your resident who stays with you, so that your male slave and your female slave may rest as well as you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, and the Lord your God brought you out of there by a mighty hand and an outstretched arm; therefore the Lord your God commanded you to celebrate the Sabbath day.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Honor your father and your mother, just as the Lord your God has commanded you, so that your days may be prolonged and that it may go well for you on the land which the Lord your God is giving you.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You shall not murder.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You shall not commit adultery.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You shall not steal.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You shall not give false testimony against your neighbor.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, nor desire your neighbor’s house, his field, his male slave or his female slave, his ox, his donkey, or anything that belongs to your neighbor.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “These words the Lord spoke to your whole assembly at the mountain from the midst of the fire, from the cloud, and from the thick darkness, with a great voice, and He added nothing more. He wrote them on two tablets of stone and gave them to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when you heard the voice from the midst of the darkness, while the mountain was burning with fire, you approached me, all the heads of your tribes and your elders.
speaker: Narrator

text: You said, ‘Behold, the Lord our God has shown us His glory and His greatness, and we have heard His voice from the midst of the fire; we have seen today that God speaks with mankind, yet he lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now then, why should we die? For this great fire will consume us; if we hear the voice of the Lord our God any longer, then we will die!
speaker: Narrator

text: For who is there of humanity who has heard the voice of the living God speaking from the midst of the fire, as we have, and lived?
speaker: Narrator

text: Go near and listen to everything that the Lord our God says; then speak to us everything that the Lord our God speaks to you, and we will listen and do it.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now the Lord heard the sound of your words when you spoke to me, and the Lord said to me, ‘I have heard the sound of the words of this people which they have spoken to you. They have done well in all that they have spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: If only they had such a heart in them, to fear Me and keep all My commandments always, so that it would go well with them and with their sons forever!
speaker: Narrator

text: Go, say to them, “Return to your tents.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, stand here by Me, that I may speak to you all the commandments, the statutes, and the judgments which you shall teach them, so that they may follow them in the land which I am giving them to possess.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall be careful to do just as the Lord your God has commanded you; you shall not turn aside to the right or to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall walk entirely in the way which the Lord your God has commanded you, so that you may live and that it may be well for you, and that you may prolong your days in the land which you will possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now this is the commandment, the statutes, and the judgments which the Lord your God has commanded me to teach you, so that you may do them in the land where you are going over to take possession of it,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you, your son, and your grandson will fear the Lord your God, to keep all His statutes and His commandments which I command you, all the days of your life, and that your days may be prolonged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Israel, you shall listen and be careful to do them, so that it may go well for you and that you may increase greatly, just as the Lord, the God of your fathers, has promised you, in a land flowing with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Hear, Israel! The Lord is our God, the Lord is one!
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: These words, which I am commanding you today, shall be on your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall repeat them diligently to your sons and speak of them when you sit in your house, when you walk on the road, when you lie down, and when you get up.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also tie them as a sign to your hand, and they shall be as frontlets on your forehead.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then it shall come about when the Lord your God brings you into the land that He swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give you, great and splendid cities which you did not build,
speaker: Narrator

text: and houses full of all good things which you did not fill, and carved cisterns which you did not carve out, vineyards and olive trees which you did not plant, and you eat and are satisfied,
speaker: Narrator

text: be careful that you do not forget the Lord who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall fear only the Lord your God; and you shall worship Him and swear by His name.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not follow other gods, any of the gods of the peoples who surround you,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the Lord your God who is in the midst of you is a jealous God; so follow Him, or else the anger of the Lord your God will be kindled against you, and He will wipe you off the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not put the Lord your God to the test, as you tested Him at Massah.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall diligently keep the commandments of the Lord your God, and His provisions and His statutes which He has commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall do what is right and good in the sight of the Lord, so that it may go well for you and that you may go in and take possession of the good land which the Lord swore to give your fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: by driving out all your enemies from you, as the Lord has spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When your son asks you in time to come, saying, ‘What do the provisions and the statutes and the judgments mean which the Lord our God commanded you?’
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall say to your son, ‘We were slaves to Pharaoh in Egypt, and the Lord brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, the Lord provided great and terrible signs and wonders before our eyes against Egypt, Pharaoh, and all his household;
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought us out of there in order to bring us in, to give us the land which He had sworn to our fathers.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord commanded us to follow all these statutes, to fear the Lord our God for our own good always and for our survival, as it is today.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it will be righteousness for us if we are careful to follow all this commandment before the Lord our God, just as He commanded us.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When the Lord your God brings you into the land where you are entering to take possession of it, and He drives away many nations from before you, the Hittites, the Girgashites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, seven nations greater and mightier than you,
speaker: Narrator

text: and when the Lord your God turns them over to you and you defeat them, you shall utterly destroy them. You shall not make a covenant with them nor be gracious to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore, you shall not intermarry with them: you shall not give your daughters to their sons, nor shall you take their daughters for your sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they will turn your sons away from following Me, and they will serve other gods; then the anger of the Lord will be kindled against you and He will quickly destroy you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But this is what you shall do to them: you shall tear down their altars, smash their memorial stones, cut their Asherim to pieces, and burn their carved images in the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you are a holy people to the Lord your God; the Lord your God has chosen you to be a people for His personal possession out of all the peoples who are on the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Lord did not make you His beloved nor choose you because you were greater in number than any of the peoples, since you were the fewest of all peoples,
speaker: Narrator

text: but because the Lord loved you and kept the oath which He swore to your forefathers, the Lord brought you out by a mighty hand and redeemed you from the house of slavery, from the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know therefore that the Lord your God, He is God, the faithful God, who keeps His covenant and His faithfulness to a thousand generations for those who love Him and keep His commandments;
speaker: Narrator

text: but He repays those who hate Him to their faces, to eliminate them; He will not hesitate toward him who hates Him, He will repay him to his face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, you shall keep the commandment, the statutes, and the judgments which I am commanding you today, to do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then it shall come about, because you listen to these judgments and keep and do them, that the Lord your God will keep His covenant with you and His faithfulness which He swore to your forefathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He will love you, bless you, and make you numerous; He will also bless the fruit of your womb and the fruit of your ground, your grain, your new wine, and your oil, the newborn of your cattle and the offspring of your flock, in the land which He swore to your forefathers to give you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall be blessed above all peoples; there will be no sterile male or infertile female among you or among your cattle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord will remove from you all sickness; and He will not inflict upon you any of the harmful diseases of Egypt which you have known, but He will give them to all who hate you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall consume all the peoples whom the Lord your God will turn over to you; your eye shall not pity them, nor shall you serve their gods, for that would be a snare to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If you say in your heart, ‘These nations are greater than I; how can I dispossess them?’
speaker: Narrator

text: you are not to be afraid of them; you shall remember well what the Lord your God did to Pharaoh and to all Egypt:
speaker: Narrator

text: the great trials which your eyes saw and the signs and the wonders, and the mighty hand and the outstretched arm by which the Lord your God brought you out. The Lord your God will do the same to all the peoples of whom you are afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, the Lord your God will send the hornet against them, until those who are left and hide themselves from you perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are not to be terrified of them, because the Lord your God is in your midst, a great and awesome God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord your God will drive away these nations from you little by little; you will not be able to put an end to them quickly, otherwise the wild animals would become too numerous for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord your God will turn them over to you, and will throw them into great confusion until they are destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He will hand over their kings to you, so that you will eliminate their name from under heaven; no one will be able to stand against you until you have destroyed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The carved images of their gods you are to burn with fire; you shall not covet the silver or the gold that is on them, nor take it for yourselves, or you will be trapped by it; for it is an abomination to the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall not bring an abomination into your house and become designated for destruction, like it; you are to utterly detest it, and you are to utterly loathe it, for it is something designated for destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: “All the commandments that I am commanding you today you shall be careful to do, so that you may live and increase, and go in and take possession of the land which the Lord swore to give to your forefathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall remember all the way which the Lord your God has led you in the wilderness these forty years, in order to humble you, putting you to the test, to know what was in your heart, whether you would keep His commandments or not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He humbled you and let you go hungry, and fed you with the manna which you did not know, nor did your fathers know, in order to make you understand that man shall not live on bread alone, but man shall live on everything that comes out of the mouth of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your clothing did not wear out on you, nor did your foot swell these forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you are to know in your heart that the Lord your God was disciplining you just as a man disciplines his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, you shall keep the commandments of the Lord your God, to walk in His ways and to fear Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord your God is bringing you into a good land, a land of streams of water, of fountains and springs, flowing out in valleys and hills;
speaker: Narrator

text: a land of wheat and barley, of vines, fig trees, and pomegranates, a land of olive oil and honey;
speaker: Narrator

text: a land where you will eat food without shortage, in which you will not lack anything; a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose hills you can dig copper.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you have eaten and are satisfied, you shall bless the Lord your God for the good land which He has given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Be careful that you do not forget the Lord your God by failing to keep His commandments, His ordinances, and His statutes which I am commanding you today;
speaker: Narrator

text: otherwise, when you eat and are satisfied, and you build good houses and live in them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and when your herds and your flocks increase, and your silver and gold increase, and everything that you have increases,
speaker: Narrator

text: then your heart will become proud and you will forget the Lord your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery;
speaker: Narrator

text: He who led you through the great and terrible wilderness, with its fiery serpents and scorpions, and its thirsty ground where there was no water; He who brought water for you out of the rock of flint.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the wilderness it was He who fed you manna which your fathers did not know, in order to humble you and in order to put you to the test, to do good for you in the end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Otherwise, you may say in your heart, ‘My power and the strength of my hand made me this wealth.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But you are to remember the Lord your God, for it is He who is giving you power to make wealth, in order to confirm His covenant which He swore to your fathers, as it is this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come about, if you ever forget the Lord your God and follow other gods and serve and worship them, I testify against you today that you will certainly perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Like the nations that the Lord eliminates from you, so you shall perish, because you would not listen to the voice of the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Hear, Israel! You are crossing the Jordan today, to go in to dispossess nations greater and mightier than you, cities that are great and fortified to heaven,
speaker: Narrator

text: a people who are great and tall, the sons of the Anakim, whom you know and of whom you have heard it said, ‘Who can stand against the sons of Anak?’
speaker: Narrator

text: So be aware today that it is the Lord your God who is crossing over ahead of you as a consuming fire. He will destroy them and He will subdue them before you, so that you may drive them out and eliminate them quickly, just as the Lord has spoken to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Do not say in your heart when the Lord your God has driven them away from you, ‘Because of my righteousness the Lord has brought me in to take possession of this land.’ Rather, it is because of the wickedness of these nations that the Lord is dispossessing them before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is not because of your righteousness or the uprightness of your heart that you are going in to take possession of their land, but it is because of the wickedness of these nations that the Lord your God is driving them out from before you, and in order to confirm the oath which the Lord swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Know, then, that it is not because of your righteousness that the Lord your God is giving you this good land to possess, for you are a stubborn people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, do not forget how you provoked the Lord your God to anger in the wilderness; from the day that you left the land of Egypt until you arrived at this place, you have been rebellious against the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even at Horeb you provoked the Lord to anger, and the Lord was so angry with you that He would have destroyed you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I went up to the mountain to receive the tablets of stone, the tablets of the covenant which the Lord made with you, then I remained on the mountain for forty days and nights; I neither ate bread nor drank water.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord gave me the two tablets of stone written by the finger of God; and on them were all the words which the Lord had spoken with you at the mountain from the midst of the fire on the day of the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: It came about at the end of forty days and nights that the Lord gave me the two tablets of stone, the tablets of the covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to me, ‘Arise, go down from here quickly, because your people, whom you brought out of Egypt, have behaved corruptly. They have quickly turned aside from the way that I commanded them; they have made a cast metal image for themselves.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord also said to me, ‘I have seen this people, and indeed, it is a stubborn people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Leave Me alone, that I may destroy them and wipe out their name from under heaven; and I will make of you a nation mightier and greater than they.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “So I turned and came down from the mountain while the mountain was burning with fire, and the two tablets of the covenant were in my two hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I saw that you had indeed sinned against the Lord your God. You had made for yourselves a cast metal image of a calf; you had quickly turned aside from the way that the Lord had commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I took hold of the two tablets and threw them from my two hands, and smashed them to pieces before your eyes!
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I fell down before the Lord like the first time, for forty days and nights; I neither ate bread nor drank water, because of all your sin which you had committed by doing what was evil in the sight of the Lord, to provoke Him to anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I was afraid of the anger and the rage with which the Lord was angry with you so as to destroy you; but the Lord listened to me that time as well.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord was also angry enough with Aaron to destroy him; so I also prayed for Aaron at the same time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I took your sinful thing which you had made, the calf, and burned it in the fire and crushed it, grinding it thoroughly until it was as fine as dust; and I threw its dust into the stream that came down from the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then at Taberah, at Massah, and at Kibroth-hattaavah you kept provoking the Lord to anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Lord sent you from Kadesh-barnea, saying, ‘Go up and take possession of the land which I have given you,’ you rebelled against the command of the Lord your God; you neither trusted Him nor listened to His voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have been rebellious toward the Lord since the day I knew you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So I fell down before the Lord for the forty days and nights, which I did because the Lord said He would destroy you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I prayed to the Lord and said, ‘Lord God, do not destroy Your people, Your inheritance, whom You have redeemed through Your greatness, whom You have brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand!
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember Your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; do not turn Your attention to the stubbornness of this people, or to their wickedness, or their sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Otherwise, the people of the land from which You brought us will say, “Since the Lord was not able to bring them into the land which He had promised them, and since He hated them, He has brought them out to kill them in the wilderness!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they are Your people, and Your inheritance, whom You brought out by Your great power and Your outstretched arm.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “At that time the Lord said to me, ‘Cut out for yourself two tablets of stone like the first two, and come up to Me on the mountain, and make an ark of wood for yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets which you smashed to pieces, and you shall put them in the ark.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So I made an ark of acacia wood and cut out two tablets of stone like the first two, and I went up on the mountain with the two tablets in my hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He wrote on the tablets, like the first writing, the Ten Commandments which the Lord had spoken to you on the mountain from the midst of the fire on the day of the assembly; and the Lord gave them to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I turned and came down from the mountain, and I put the tablets in the ark which I had made; and they are there, just as the Lord commanded me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now the sons of Israel set out from Beeroth Bene-jaakan to Moserah. There Aaron died and there he was buried, and his son Eleazar served as priest in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there they set out to Gudgodah, and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land of streams of water.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time the Lord singled out the tribe of Levi to carry the ark of the covenant of the Lord, to stand before the Lord to serve Him and to bless in His name, until this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, Levi does not have a portion or inheritance with his brothers; the Lord is his inheritance, just as the Lord your God spoke to him.)
speaker: Narrator

text: “I, moreover, stayed on the mountain for forty days and forty nights like the first time, and the Lord listened to me that time also; the Lord was not willing to destroy you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to me, ‘Arise, proceed on your journey ahead of the people, so that they may go in and take possession of the land which I swore to their fathers to give them.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “And now, Israel, what does the Lord your God require of you, but to fear the Lord your God, to walk in all His ways and love Him, and to serve the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to keep the Lord’s commandments and His statutes which I am commanding you today for your good?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, to the Lord your God belong heaven and the highest heavens, the earth and all that is in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the Lord set His affection on your fathers, to love them, and He chose their descendants after them, you over all the other peoples, as it is this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: So circumcise your heart, and do not stiffen your neck any longer.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord your God is the God of gods and the Lord of lords, the great, the mighty, and the awesome God, who does not show partiality, nor take a bribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: He executes justice for the orphan and the widow, and shows His love for the stranger by giving him food and clothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: So show your love for the stranger, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall fear the Lord your God; you shall serve Him, and cling to Him, and you shall swear by His name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is your glory and He is your God, who has done these great and awesome things for you which your eyes have seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your fathers went down to Egypt seventy persons in all, and now the Lord your God has made you as numerous as the stars of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall therefore love the Lord your God, and always keep His directive, His statutes, His ordinances, and His commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know this day that I am not speaking with your sons who have not known and who have not seen the discipline of the Lord your God—His greatness, His mighty hand, His outstretched arm,
speaker: Narrator

text: and His signs and His works which He did in the midst of Egypt to Pharaoh the king of Egypt and to all his land;
speaker: Narrator

text: and what He did to Egypt’s army, to its horses and its chariots, when He made the water of the Red Sea engulf them while they were pursuing you, and the Lord completely eliminated them;
speaker: Narrator

text: and what He did to you in the wilderness, until you came to this place;
speaker: Narrator

text: and what He did to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, the son of Reuben, when the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them, their households, their tents, and every living thing that followed them, among all Israel—
speaker: Narrator

text: but your own eyes have seen all the great work of the Lord which He did.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall therefore keep every commandment which I am commanding you today, so that you may be strong and go in and take possession of the land into which you are about to cross to possess it;
speaker: Narrator

text: and so that you may prolong your days on the land which the Lord swore to your fathers to give to them and to their descendants, a land flowing with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the land, into which you are entering to possess it, is not like the land of Egypt from which you came, where you used to sow your seed and water it by your foot like a vegetable garden.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the land into which you are about to cross to possess it, a land of hills and valleys, drinks water from the rain of heaven,
speaker: Narrator

text: a land for which the Lord your God cares; the eyes of the Lord your God are continually on it, from the beginning even to the end of the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And it shall come about, if you listen obediently to my commandments which I am commanding you today, to love the Lord your God and to serve Him with all your heart and all your soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: that He will provide rain for your land in its season, the early and late rain, so that you may gather your grain, your new wine, and your oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will also provide grass in your field for your cattle, and you will eat and be satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware that your hearts are not easily deceived, and that you do not turn away and serve other gods, and worship them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Otherwise, the anger of the Lord will be kindled against you, and He will shut up the sky so that there will be no rain, and the ground will not yield its produce; then you will quickly perish from the good land which the Lord is giving you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall therefore take these words of mine to heart and to soul; and you shall tie them as a sign on your hand, and they shall be as frontlets on your forehead.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also teach them to your sons, speaking of them when you sit in your house, when you walk along the road, when you lie down, and when you get up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that your days and the days of your sons may be increased on the land which the Lord swore to your fathers to give them, as long as the heavens are above the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if you are careful to keep all of this commandment which I am commanding you to do, to love the Lord your God, to walk in all His ways and cling to Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the Lord will dispossess all these nations from you, and you will dispossess nations greater and mightier than you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every place on which the sole of your foot steps shall be yours; your border will be from the wilderness to Lebanon, and from the river, the river Euphrates, as far as the western sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one will be able to stand against you; the Lord your God will instill the dread of you and the fear of you in all the land on which you set foot, just as He has spoken to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “See, I am placing before you today a blessing and a curse:
speaker: Narrator

text: the blessing, if you listen to the commandments of the Lord your God, which I am commanding you today;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the curse, if you do not listen to the commandments of the Lord your God, but turn aside from the way which I am commanding you today, by following other gods which you have not known.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And it shall come about, when the Lord your God brings you into the land where you are entering to possess it, that you shall place the blessing on Mount Gerizim and the curse on Mount Ebal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Are they not across the Jordan, west of the road toward the sunset, in the land of the Canaanites who live in the Arabah, opposite Gilgal, beside the oaks of Moreh?
speaker: Narrator

text: For you are about to cross the Jordan to go in to take possession of the land which the Lord your God is giving you, and you shall possess it and live in it,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall be careful to do all the statutes and the judgments which I am placing before you today.
speaker: Narrator

text: “These are the statutes and the judgments which you shall carefully follow in the land which the Lord, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess as long as you live on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall utterly destroy all the places where the nations whom you are going to dispossess serve their gods, on the high mountains, on the hills, and under every leafy tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall tear down their altars and smash their memorial stones to pieces, and burn their Asherim in the fire, and cut to pieces the carved images of their gods; and you shall eliminate their name from that place.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not act this way toward the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you shall seek the Lord at the place which the Lord your God will choose from all your tribes, to establish His name there for His dwelling, and you shall come there.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall bring there your burnt offerings, your sacrifices, your tithes, the contribution of your hand, your vowed offerings, your voluntary offerings, and the firstborn of your herd and of your flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: There you and your households shall eat before the Lord your God, and rejoice in all your undertakings in which the Lord your God has blessed you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not do at all what we are doing here today, everyone doing whatever is right in his own eyes;
speaker: Narrator

text: for you have not as yet come to the resting place and the inheritance which the Lord your God is giving you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you cross the Jordan and live in the land which the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, and He gives you rest from all your enemies around you so that you live in security,
speaker: Narrator

text: then it shall come about that the place in which the Lord your God will choose for His name to dwell, there you shall bring everything that I command you: your burnt offerings and your sacrifices, your tithes and the contribution of your hand, and all your choice vowed offerings which you will vow to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall rejoice before the Lord your God, you and your sons and daughters, your male and female slaves, and the Levite who is within your gates, since he has no portion or inheritance with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Be careful that you do not offer your burnt offerings in any cultic place that you see,
speaker: Narrator

text: but only in the place which the Lord chooses in one of your tribes: there you shall offer your burnt offerings, and there you shall do everything that I command you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “However, you may slaughter and eat meat within any of your gates, whatever you desire, according to the blessing of the Lord your God which He has given you; the unclean and the clean alike may eat it, as the gazelle and the deer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only you shall not eat the blood; you are to pour it out on the ground like water.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are not allowed to eat within your gates the tithe of your grain, new wine, or oil, or the firstborn of your herd or flock, or any of your vowed offerings which you vow, or your voluntary offerings, or the contribution of your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you shall eat them before the Lord your God in the place which the Lord your God will choose, you and your son and daughter, and your male and female slaves, and the Levite who is within your gates; and you shall rejoice before the Lord your God in all your undertakings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be careful that you do not abandon the Levite as long as you live in your land.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When the Lord your God extends your border as He has promised you, and you say, ‘I will eat meat,’ because you desire to eat meat, then you may eat meat, whatever you desire.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the place where the Lord your God chooses to put His name is too far from you, then you may slaughter animals from your herd and flock which the Lord has given you, as I have commanded you; and you may eat within your gates whatever you desire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as a gazelle or a deer is eaten, so you may eat it; the unclean and the clean alike may eat it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only be sure not to eat the blood, for the blood is the life, and you shall not eat the life with the flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not eat it; you shall pour it out on the ground like water.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not eat it, so that it may go well for you and your sons after you, since you will be doing what is right in the sight of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only your holy things which you may have and your vowed offerings, you shall take and go to the place which the Lord chooses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood, on the altar of the Lord your God; and the blood of your sacrifices shall be poured out on the altar of the Lord your God, and you shall eat the flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Be careful and listen to all these words which I am commanding you, so that it may go well for you and your sons after you forever, for you will be doing what is good and right in the sight of the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When the Lord your God cuts off from you the nations which you are going in to dispossess, and you dispossess them and live in their land,
speaker: Narrator

text: be careful that you are not ensnared to follow them, after they are destroyed from your presence, and that you do not inquire about their gods, saying, ‘How do these nations serve their gods, that I also may do likewise?’
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not behave this way toward the Lord your God, because every abominable act which the Lord hates, they have done for their gods; for they even burn their sons and daughters in the fire for their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Whatever I command you, you shall be careful to do; you shall not add to nor take anything away from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a prophet or a dreamer of dreams arises among you and gives you a sign or a wonder,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the sign or the wonder comes true, of which he spoke to you, saying, ‘Let’s follow other gods (whom you have not known) and let’s serve them,’
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall not listen to the words of that prophet or dreamer of dreams; for the Lord your God is testing you to find out whether you love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall follow the Lord your God and fear Him; and you shall keep His commandments, listen to His voice, serve Him, and cling to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But that prophet or that dreamer of dreams shall be put to death, because he has spoken falsely against the Lord your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt and redeemed you from the house of slavery, to drive you from the way in which the Lord your God commanded you to walk. So you shall eliminate the evil from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If your brother, your mother’s son, or your son or daughter, or the wife you cherish, or your friend who is like your own soul, entices you secretly, saying, ‘Let’s go and serve other gods’ (whom neither you nor your fathers have known,
speaker: Narrator

text: of the gods of the peoples who are around you, near you, or far from you, from one end of the earth to the other end),
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall not consent to him or listen to him; and your eye shall not pity him, nor shall you spare or conceal him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, you shall most certainly kill him; your hand shall be first against him to put him to death, and afterward the hand of all the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall stone him to death, because he has attempted to drive you away from the Lord your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all Israel will hear about it and be afraid, and will not do such a wicked thing among you again.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If you hear in one of your cities, which the Lord your God is giving you to live in, anyone saying that
speaker: Narrator

text: some worthless men have gone out from among you and have seduced the inhabitants of their city, saying, ‘Let’s go and serve other gods’ (whom you have not known),
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall investigate, search out, and inquire thoroughly. And if it is true and the matter is certain that this abomination has been committed among you,
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall most certainly strike the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword. Utterly destroy it and all who are in it and its cattle, with the edge of the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall gather all its plunder into the middle of its public square, and burn the city and all its plunder with fire as a whole burnt offering to the Lord your God; and it shall be a ruin forever. It shall never be rebuilt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nothing at all from what is designated for destruction is to cling to your hand, in order that the Lord may turn from His burning anger and show mercy to you, and have compassion on you and make you increase, just as He has sworn to your fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: if you will listen to the voice of the Lord your God, keeping all His commandments which I am commanding you today, and doing what is right in the sight of the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You are sons of the Lord your God; you shall not cut yourselves nor shave a bald spot above your forehead for the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you are a holy people to the Lord your God, and the Lord has chosen you to be a people for His personal possession out of all the peoples who are on the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not eat any detestable thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the animals that you may eat: the ox, the sheep, the goat,
speaker: Narrator

text: the deer, the gazelle, the roebuck, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, and the mountain sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And any animal that has a divided hoof and has its hoofs split in two, and chews the cud, among the animals, that animal you may eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, you are not to eat these among the ones that chew the cud, or among those that have the hoof divided in two: the camel, the rabbit, and the rock hyrax, for though they chew the cud, they do not have a divided hoof; they are unclean to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the pig, because it has a divided hoof but does not chew the cud, it is unclean for you. You shall not eat any of their flesh, nor touch their carcasses.
speaker: Narrator

text: “These you may eat of everything that is in the water: anything that has fins and scales you may eat,
speaker: Narrator

text: but anything that does not have fins and scales, you shall not eat; it is unclean for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You may eat any clean bird.
speaker: Narrator

text: But these are the ones that you shall not eat: the eagle and the vulture and the buzzard,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the red kite, the falcon, and the kite in their kinds,
speaker: Narrator

text: and every raven in its kind,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the ostrich, the owl, the seagull, and the hawk in their kinds,
speaker: Narrator

text: the little owl, the great owl, the white owl,
speaker: Narrator

text: the pelican, the carrion vulture, the cormorant,
speaker: Narrator

text: the stork, and the heron in their kinds, and the hoopoe and the bat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the swarming insects with wings are unclean to you; they shall not be eaten.
speaker: Narrator

text: You may eat any clean bird.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not eat anything which dies of itself. You may give it to the stranger who is in your town, so that he may eat it, or you may sell it to a stranger; for you are a holy people to the Lord your God. You shall not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall certainly tithe all the produce from what you sow, which comes from the field every year.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall eat in the presence of the Lord your God, at the place where He chooses to establish His name, the tithe of your grain, your new wine, your oil, and the firstborn of your herd and your flock, so that you may learn to fear the Lord your God always.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the distance is so great for you that you are not able to bring the tithe, since the place where the Lord your God chooses to set His name is too far away from you when the Lord your God blesses you,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall exchange it for money, and bind the money in your hand and go to the place which the Lord your God chooses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you may spend the money on whatever your heart desires: on oxen, sheep, wine, other strong drink, or whatever your heart desires; and there you shall eat in the presence of the Lord your God and rejoice, you and your household.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also you shall not neglect the Levite who is in your town, for he has no portion or inheritance among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “At the end of every third year you shall bring out all the tithe of your produce in that year, and you shall deposit it in your town.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Levite, because he has no portion or inheritance among you, and the stranger, the orphan, and the widow who are in your town, shall come and eat and be satisfied, in order that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work of your hand which you do.
speaker: Narrator

text: “At the end of every seven years you shall grant a release of debts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the regulation for the release of debts: every creditor is to forgive what he has loaned to his neighbor; he shall not require it of his neighbor and his brother, because the Lord’s release has been proclaimed.
speaker: Narrator

text: From a foreigner you may require it, but your hand shall forgive whatever of yours is with your brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, there will be no poor among you, since the Lord will certainly bless you in the land which the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance to possess,
speaker: Narrator

text: if only you listen obediently to the voice of the Lord your God, to follow carefully all this commandment which I am commanding you today.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord your God will have blessed you just as He has promised you, and you will lend to many nations, but you will not borrow; and you will rule over many nations, but they will not rule over you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If there is a poor person among you, one of your brothers, in any of your towns in your land which the Lord your God is giving you, you shall not harden your heart, nor close your hand from your poor brother;
speaker: Narrator

text: but you shall fully open your hand to him, and generously lend him enough for his need in whatever he lacks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be careful that there is no mean-spirited thought in your heart, such as, ‘The seventh year, the year of release of debts, is near,’ and your eye is malicious toward your poor brother, and you give him nothing; then he may cry out to the Lord against you, and it will be a sin in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall generously give to him, and your heart shall not be grudging when you give to him, because for this thing the Lord your God will bless you in all your work, and in all your undertakings.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the poor will not cease to exist in the land; therefore I am commanding you, saying, ‘You shall fully open your hand to your brother, to your needy and poor in your land.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “If your fellow countryman, a Hebrew man or woman, is sold to you, then he shall serve you for six years, but in the seventh year you shall set him free.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when you set him free, you shall not send him away empty-handed.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall give generously to him from your flock, your threshing floor, and from your wine vat; you shall give to him as the Lord your God has blessed you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you are to remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, and the Lord your God redeemed you; therefore I am commanding this of you today.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it shall come about, if he says to you, ‘I will not leave you,’ because he loves you and your household, since he is doing well with you,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall take an awl and pierce it through his ear into the door, and he shall be your servant permanently. You shall also do the same to your female slave.
speaker: Narrator

text: “It shall not seem difficult for you when you set him free, because he has given you six years with double the service of a hired worker; so the Lord your God will bless you in whatever you do.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall consecrate to the Lord your God all the firstborn males that are born in your herd and in your flock; you shall not work with the firstborn of your herd, nor shear the firstborn of your flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: You and your household shall eat it every year before the Lord your God in the place which the Lord chooses.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if it has any impairment, such as a limp, or blindness, or any serious impairment, you shall not sacrifice it to the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall eat it within your gates; the unclean and the clean alike may eat it, as a gazelle or a deer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only you shall not eat its blood; you are to pour it out on the ground like water.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Observe the month of Abib and celebrate the Passover to the Lord your God, for in the month of Abib the Lord your God brought you out of Egypt by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall sacrifice the Passover to the Lord your God from the flock and the herd, in the place where the Lord chooses to establish His name.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not eat leavened bread with it; for seven days you shall eat unleavened bread with it, the bread of affliction (for you came out of the land of Egypt in a hurry), so that you will remember the day when you came out of the land of Egypt all the days of your life.
speaker: Narrator

text: For seven days no leaven shall be seen with you in your entire territory, and none of the meat which you sacrifice on the evening of the first day shall be left overnight until the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are not allowed to sacrifice the Passover in any of your towns which the Lord your God is giving you;
speaker: Narrator

text: but only at the place where the Lord your God chooses to establish His name, you shall sacrifice the Passover in the evening at sunset, at the time that you came out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall cook and eat it in the place which the Lord your God chooses. In the morning you are to return to your tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: For six days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a festive assembly to the Lord your God; you shall do no work on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall count seven weeks for yourself; you shall begin to count seven weeks from the time you begin to put the sickle to the standing grain.
speaker: Narrator
