text: Then you shall celebrate the Feast of Weeks to the Lord your God with a voluntary offering of your hand in a proportional amount, which you shall give just as the Lord your God blesses you;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall rejoice before the Lord your God, you, your son and your daughter, and your male and female slaves, and the Levite who is in your town, and the stranger, the orphan, and the widow who are in your midst, at the place where the Lord your God chooses to establish His name.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also remember that you were a slave in Egypt, and you shall be careful and comply with these statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall celebrate the Feast of Booths for seven days when you have gathered in from your threshing floor and your wine vat;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall rejoice in your feast, you, your son and your daughter, and your male and female slaves, and the Levite, the stranger, the orphan, and the widow who are in your towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: For seven days you shall celebrate a feast to the Lord your God in the place which the Lord chooses, because the Lord your God will bless you in all your produce and in all the work of your hands, so that you will be altogether joyful.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Three times a year all your males shall appear before the Lord your God at the place which He chooses: at the Feast of Unleavened Bread, at the Feast of Weeks, and at the Feast of Booths; and they are not to appear before the Lord empty-handed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone shall give as he is able, in accordance with the blessing of the Lord your God which He has given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall appoint for yourself judges and officers in all your towns which the Lord your God is giving you, according to your tribes, and they shall judge the people with righteous judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not distort justice, you shall not show partiality; and you shall not accept a bribe, because a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise and distorts the words of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Justice, and only justice, you shall pursue, so that you may live and possess the land which the Lord your God is giving you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not plant for yourself an Asherah of any kind of tree beside the altar of the Lord your God, which you shall make for yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall not set up for yourself a memorial stone, which the Lord your God hates.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not sacrifice to the Lord your God an ox or a sheep which has a blemish or any defect, for that is a detestable thing to the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If there is found in your midst, in any of your towns which the Lord your God is giving you, a man or a woman who does what is evil in the sight of the Lord your God, by violating His covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that person has gone and served other gods and worshiped them, or the sun, the moon, or any of the heavenly lights, which I have commanded not to do,
speaker: Narrator

text: and if it is reported to you and you have heard about it, then you shall investigate thoroughly. And if it is true and the report is trustworthy that this detestable thing has been done in Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you are to bring out to your gates that man or woman who has done this evil deed, that is, the man or the woman, and you shall stone them to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the testimony of two witnesses or three witnesses, the condemned shall be put to death; he shall not be put to death on the testimony of only one witness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hands of the witnesses shall be first against him to put him to death, and afterward the hands of all the people. So you shall eliminate the evil from your midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a case is too difficult for you to decide, between one kind of homicide or another, between one kind of lawsuit or another, and between one kind of assault or another, that are cases of dispute in your courts, then you shall arise and go up to the place which the Lord your God chooses.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall come to the Levitical priests or the judge who is in office in those days, and you shall inquire of them and they will declare to you the verdict.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall act in accordance with the terms of the verdict which they declare to you from that place which the Lord chooses; and you shall be careful to act in accordance with everything that they instruct you to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: In accordance with the terms of the law about which they instruct you, and in accordance with the verdict which they tell you, you shall act; you shall not turn aside from the word which they declare to you, to the right or the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the person who acts insolently by not listening to the priest who stands there to serve the Lord your God, nor to the judge, that person shall die; so you shall eliminate the evil from Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the people will hear and be afraid, and will not act insolently again.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you enter the land which the Lord your God is giving you, and you take possession of it and live in it, and you say, ‘I will appoint a king over me like all the nations who are around me,’
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall in fact appoint a king over you whom the Lord your God chooses. One from among your countrymen you shall appoint as king over yourselves; you may not put a foreigner over yourselves, anyone who is not your countryman.
speaker: Narrator

text: In any case, he is not to acquire many horses for himself, nor shall he make the people return to Egypt in order to acquire many horses, since the Lord has said to you, ‘You shall never again return that way.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall not acquire many wives for himself, so that his heart does not turn away; nor shall he greatly increase silver and gold for himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now it shall come about, when he sits on the throne of his kingdom, that he shall write for himself a copy of this Law on a scroll in the presence of the Levitical priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be with him, and he shall read it all the days of his life, so that he will learn to fear the Lord his God, by carefully following all the words of this Law and these statutes,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that his heart will not be haughty toward his countrymen, and that he will not turn away from the commandment to the right or the left, so that he and his sons may live long in his kingdom in the midst of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Levitical priests, the whole tribe of Levi, shall not have a portion or inheritance with Israel; they shall eat the Lord’s offerings by fire and His property.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall not have an inheritance among their countrymen; the Lord is their inheritance, as He promised them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now this shall be the priests’ portion from the people, from those who offer a sacrifice, either an ox or a sheep: they shall give the priest the shoulder, the two cheeks, and the stomach.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall give him the first fruits of your grain, your new wine, and your oil, and the first fleece of your sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord your God has chosen him and his sons from all your tribes, to stand to serve in the name of the Lord always.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now if a Levite comes from any of your towns throughout Israel where he resides, and he comes whenever he desires to the place which the Lord chooses,
speaker: Narrator

text: then he shall serve in the name of the Lord his God, like all his fellow Levites who stand there before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall eat equal portions, except for what they receive from the sale of their fathers’ estates.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you enter the land which the Lord your God is giving you, you shall not learn to imitate the detestable things of those nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall not be found among you anyone who makes his son or his daughter pass through the fire, one who uses divination, a soothsayer, one who interprets omens, or a sorcerer,
speaker: Narrator

text: or one who casts a spell, or a medium, or a spiritist, or one who consults the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever does these things is detestable to the Lord; and because of these detestable things the Lord your God is going to drive them out before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to be blameless before the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For these nations, which you are going to dispossess, listen to soothsayers and diviners, but as for you, the Lord your God has not allowed you to do so.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among you, from your countrymen; to him you shall listen.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is in accordance with everything that you asked of the Lord your God at Horeb on the day of the assembly, saying, ‘Do not let me hear the voice of the Lord my God again, and do not let me see this great fire anymore, or I will die!’
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to me, ‘They have spoken well.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will raise up for them a prophet from among their countrymen like you, and I will put My words in his mouth, and he shall speak to them everything that I command him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come about that whoever does not listen to My words which he speaks in My name, I Myself will require it of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the prophet who speaks a word presumptuously in My name, a word which I have not commanded him to speak, or which he speaks in the name of other gods, that prophet shall die.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And if you say in your heart, ‘How will we recognize the word which the Lord has not spoken?’
speaker: Narrator

text: When the prophet speaks in the name of the Lord, and the thing does not happen or come true, that is the thing which the Lord has not spoken. The prophet has spoken it presumptuously; you are not to be afraid of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When the Lord your God cuts off the nations whose land the Lord your God is giving you, and you dispossess them and settle in their cities and in their houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall set aside for yourself three cities in the midst of your land which the Lord your God is giving you to possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall prepare the roads for yourself, and divide into three regions the territory of your land which the Lord your God will give you as an inheritance, so that anyone who commits manslaughter may flee there.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now this is the case of the one who commits manslaughter, who may flee there and live: when he kills his friend unintentionally, not hating him previously—
speaker: Narrator

text: as when a person goes into the forest with his friend to cut wood, and his hand swings the axe to cut down the tree, and the iron head slips off the handle and strikes his friend so that he dies—he may flee to one of these cities and live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Otherwise, the avenger of blood might pursue him in the heat of his anger, and overtake him because the way is long, and take his life, though he was not sentenced to death since he had not hated him previously.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I command you, saying, ‘You shall set aside for yourself three cities.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “And if the Lord your God enlarges your territory, just as He has sworn to your fathers, and gives you all the land that He promised to give your fathers—
speaker: Narrator

text: if you carefully follow all of this commandment which I am commanding you today, to love the Lord your God, and to walk in His ways always—then you shall add three more cities for yourself, besides these three.
speaker: Narrator

text: So innocent blood will not be shed in the midst of your land which the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, and guilt for bloodshed will not be on you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But if there is a person who hates his neighbor, and waits in ambush for him and rises up against him and strikes him so that he dies, and he flees to one of these cities,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the elders of his city shall send men and take him from there, and hand him over to the avenger of blood, so that he may die.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not pity him, but you shall eliminate the guilt for the bloodshed of the innocent from Israel, so that it may go well for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not displace your neighbor’s boundary marker, which the ancestors have set, in your inheritance which you will inherit in the land that the Lord your God is giving you to possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: “A single witness shall not rise up against a person regarding any wrongdoing or any sin that he commits; on the testimony of two or three witnesses a matter shall be confirmed.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a malicious witness rises up against a person to testify against him of wrongdoing,
speaker: Narrator

text: then both people who have the dispute shall stand before the Lord, before the priests and the judges who will be in office in those days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the judges shall investigate thoroughly, and if the witness is a false witness and he has testified against his brother falsely,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall do to him just as he had planned to do to his brother. So you shall eliminate the evil from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rest of the people will hear and be afraid, and will never again do such an evil thing among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall not show pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, and foot for foot.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you go out to battle against your enemies and see horses, chariots, and people more numerous than you, do not be afraid of them; for the Lord your God, who brought you up from the land of Egypt, is with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you are approaching the battle, the priest shall come forward and speak to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall say to them, ‘Hear, Israel, you are approaching the battle against your enemies today. Do not be fainthearted. Do not be afraid, or panic, or be terrified by them,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the Lord your God is the One who is going with you, to fight for you against your enemies, to save you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The officers also shall speak to the people, saying, ‘Who is the man that has built a new house but has not dedicated it? Let him go and return to his house, otherwise he might die in the battle and another man would dedicate it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And who is the man that has planted a vineyard but has not put it to use? Let him go and return to his house, otherwise he might die in the battle and another man would put it to use.
speaker: Narrator

text: And who is the man that is betrothed to a woman and has not married her? Let him go and return to his house, otherwise he might die in the battle and another man would marry her.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the officers shall speak further to the people and say, ‘Who is the man that is afraid and fainthearted? Let him go and return to his house, so that he does not make his brothers’ hearts melt like his heart!’
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the officers have finished speaking to the people, they shall appoint commanders of armies at the head of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you approach a city to fight against it, you shall offer it terms of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if it agrees to make peace with you and opens to you, then all the people who are found in it shall become your forced labor and serve you.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, if it does not make peace with you, but makes war against you, then you shall besiege it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord your God gives it into your hand, you shall strike all the men in it with the edge of the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, the women, the children, the animals, and everything that is in the city, all of its spoils, you shall take as plunder for yourself; and you shall use the spoils of your enemies which the Lord your God has given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what you shall do to all the cities that are very far from you, which are not of the cities of these nations nearby.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only in the cities of these peoples that the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, you shall not leave anything that breathes alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, you shall utterly destroy them, the Hittite and the Amorite, the Canaanite and the Perizzite, the Hivite and the Jebusite, just as the Lord your God has commanded you,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that they will not teach you to do all the same detestable practices of theirs which they have done for their gods, by which you would sin against the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you besiege a city for a long time, to make war against it in order to capture it, you shall not destroy its trees by swinging an axe against them; for you may eat from them, so you shall not cut them down. For is the tree of the field a human, that it should be besieged by you?
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the trees that you know are not fruit trees you shall destroy and cut down, so that you may construct siegeworks against the city that is making war against you until it falls.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a person who has been killed by someone is found lying in the open country in the land which the Lord your God is giving you to possess, and it is not known who struck him,
speaker: Narrator

text: then your elders and your judges shall go out and measure the distance to the cities which are around the one who was killed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be that the city which is nearest to the person killed, that is, that the elders of that city shall take a heifer of the herd that has not been worked and has not pulled in a yoke;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the elders of that city shall bring the heifer down to a valley with running water, which has not been plowed or sown, and they shall break the heifer’s neck there in the valley.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priests, the sons of Levi, shall come forward, because the Lord your God has chosen them to serve Him and to bless in the name of the Lord; and every dispute and violent crime shall be settled by them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the elders of that city which is nearest to the person killed shall wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the valley;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall respond and say, ‘Our hands did not shed this blood, nor did our eyes see who did.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forgive Your people Israel whom You have redeemed, Lord, and do not place the guilt for innocent blood in the midst of Your people Israel.’ And the guilt for bloodshed shall be forgiven them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall remove the guilt for innocent blood from your midst, when you do what is right in the eyes of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you go out to battle against your enemies, and the Lord your God hands them over to you and you take them away captive,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you see among the captives a beautiful woman, and are strongly attracted to her and would take her as a wife for yourself,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall bring her into your home, and she shall shave her head and trim her nails.
speaker: Narrator

text: She shall also remove the clothes of her captivity and shall remain in your house, and weep for her father and mother a full month; and after that you may have relations with her and become her husband and she shall be your wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it shall be, if you are not pleased with her, then you shall let her go wherever she wishes; and you certainly shall not sell her for money, you shall not treat her as merchandise, since you have humiliated her.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a man has two wives, the one loved and the other unloved, and both the loved and the unloved have borne him sons, and the firstborn son belongs to the unloved,
speaker: Narrator

text: then it shall be on the day that he wills what he owns as an inheritance to his sons, he is not allowed to treat the son of the loved wife as the firstborn, at the expense of the son of the unloved, who actually is the firstborn son.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the contrary, he shall acknowledge the firstborn, the son of the unloved wife, by giving him a double portion of everything that he owns, for he was the beginning of his strength; to him belongs the right of the firstborn.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If any person has a stubborn and rebellious son who does not obey his father or his mother, and when they discipline him, he does not listen to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: then his father and mother shall seize him, and bring him out to the elders of his city at the gateway of his hometown.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall say to the elders of his city, ‘This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious; he does not obey us, he is thoughtless and given to drinking.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the men of his city shall stone him to death; so you shall eliminate the evil from your midst, and all Israel will hear about it and fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now if a person has committed a sin carrying a sentence of death and he is put to death, and you hang him on a tree,
speaker: Narrator

text: his body is not to be left overnight on the tree, but you shall certainly bury him on the same day (for he who is hanged is cursed of God), so that you do not defile your land which the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not see your countryman’s ox or his sheep straying away, and avoid them; you shall certainly bring them back to your countryman.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if your countryman is not near you, or if you do not know him, then you shall bring it to your house, and it shall remain with you until your countryman looks for it; then you shall restore it to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also do this with his donkey, and you shall do the same with his garment, and you shall do likewise with any lost property of your countryman, which has been lost by him and you have found. You are not allowed to avoid them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not see your countryman’s donkey or his ox fallen down on the road, and avoid them; you shall certainly help him raise them up.
speaker: Narrator

text: “A woman shall not wear a man’s clothing, nor shall a man put on a woman’s clothing; for whoever does these things is an abomination to the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If you happen to come upon a bird’s nest along the way, in any tree or on the ground, with young ones or eggs in it, and the mother sitting on the young or on the eggs, you shall not take the mother with the young;
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall certainly let the mother go, but the young you may take for yourself, in order that it may go well for you and that you may prolong your days.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you build a new house, you shall make a parapet for your roof, so that you will not bring guilt for bloodshed on your house if anyone falls from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not sow your vineyard with two kinds of seed, otherwise all the produce of the seed which you have sown and the yield of the vineyard will be forfeited to the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not plow with an ox and a donkey together.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not wear a material of wool and linen combined together.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall make yourself tassels on the four corners of your garment with which you cover yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If any man takes a wife and goes in to her and then turns against her,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he charges her with shameful behavior and publicly defames her, and says, ‘I took this woman, but when I came near her, I did not find her to have evidence of virginity,’
speaker: Narrator

text: then the girl’s father and her mother shall take and bring out the evidence of the girl’s virginity to the elders of the city at the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the girl’s father shall say to the elders, ‘I gave my daughter to this man as a wife, but he turned against her;
speaker: Narrator

text: and behold, he has charged her with shameful behavior, saying, “I did not find your daughter to have evidence of virginity.” But this is the evidence of my daughter’s virginity.’ And they shall spread out the garment before the elders of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the elders of that city shall take the man and rebuke him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall fine him a hundred shekels of silver and give it to the girl’s father, because he publicly defamed a virgin of Israel. And she shall remain his wife; he is not allowed to divorce her all his days.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But if this charge is true, and they did not find the girl to have evidence of virginity,
speaker: Narrator

text: then they shall bring the girl out to the doorway of her father’s house, and the men of her city shall stone her to death, because she has committed a disgraceful sin in Israel by playing the prostitute in her father’s house; so you shall eliminate the evil from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a man is found sleeping with a married woman, then both of them shall die, the man who slept with the woman, and the woman; so you shall eliminate the evil from Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If there is a girl who is a virgin betrothed to a man, and another man finds her in the city and sleeps with her,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall bring them both out to the gate of that city and you shall stone them to death: the girl, because she did not cry out for help though she was in the city, and the man, because he has violated his neighbor’s wife. So you shall eliminate the evil from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But if the man finds the girl who is betrothed in the field, and the man seizes her and rapes her, then only the man who raped her shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you are not to do anything to the girl; there is no sin in the girl worthy of death, for just as a man rises against his neighbor and murders him, so is this case.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he found her in the field, the betrothed girl cried out, but there was no one to save her.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a man finds a girl who is a virgin, who is not betrothed, and he seizes her and has sexual relations with her, and they are discovered,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the man who had sexual relations with her shall give the girl’s father fifty shekels of silver, and she shall become his wife, because he has violated her; he is not allowed to divorce her all his days.
speaker: Narrator

text: “A man shall not take his father’s wife in marriage, so that he does not uncover his father’s garment.
speaker: Narrator

text: “No one who is emasculated or has his male organ cut off may enter the assembly of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one of illegitimate birth may enter the assembly of the Lord; none of his descendants, even to the tenth generation, may enter the assembly of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: No Ammonite or Moabite may enter the assembly of the Lord; none of their descendants, even to the tenth generation, may ever enter the assembly of the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: because they did not meet you with food and water on the way when you came out of Egypt, and because they hired against you Balaam the son of Beor from Pethor of Mesopotamia, to curse you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, the Lord your God was unwilling to listen to Balaam, but the Lord your God turned the curse into a blessing for you because the Lord your God loves you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall never seek their peace or their prosperity all your days.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not loathe an Edomite, for he is your brother; you shall not loathe an Egyptian, because you were a stranger in his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of the third generation who are born to them may enter the assembly of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you go out as an army against your enemies, you shall be on guard against every evil thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If there is among you any man who is unclean because of a nocturnal emission, then he must go outside the camp; he may not reenter the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when evening approaches, he shall bathe himself with water, and at sundown he may reenter the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall also have a place allocated outside the camp, so that you may go out there to relieve yourself,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall have a spade among your tools, and it shall be when you sit down outside, you shall dig with it and shall turn and cover up your excrement.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since the Lord your God walks in the midst of your camp to save you and to defeat your enemies before you, your camp must be holy; so He must not see anything indecent among you or He will turn away from you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not hand over to his master a slave who has escaped from his master to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall live with you in your midst, in the place that he chooses in one of your towns where it pleases him; you shall not mistreat him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “None of the daughters of Israel shall be a cult prostitute, nor shall any of the sons of Israel be a cult prostitute.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not bring the earnings of a prostitute or the money for a dog into the house of the Lord your God as payment for any vowed offering, because both of these are an abomination to the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You are not to charge interest to your countrymen: interest on money, food, or anything that may be loaned on interest.
speaker: Narrator

text: You may charge interest to a foreigner, but to your countrymen you shall not charge interest, so that the Lord your God may bless you in all that you undertake in the land which you are about to enter to possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you make a vow to the Lord your God, you shall not delay to pay it, for the Lord your God will certainly require it of you, and it will be a sin for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, if you refrain from making vows, it will not be a sin for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall be careful and perform what goes out of your lips, since in fact you have vowed a voluntary offering to the Lord your God, whatever you have promised.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you enter your neighbor’s vineyard, you may eat grapes until you are satisfied; but you are not to put any in your basket.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you enter your neighbor’s standing grain, you may pluck the heads of grain with your hand, but you are not to use a sickle on your neighbor’s standing grain.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When a man takes a wife and marries her, and it happens, if she finds no favor in his eyes because he has found some indecency in her, that he writes her a certificate of divorce, puts it in her hand, and sends her away from his house,
speaker: Narrator

text: and she leaves his house and goes and becomes another man’s wife,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the latter husband turns against her, writes her a certificate of divorce and puts it in her hand, and sends her away from his house, or if the latter husband who took her to be his wife dies,
speaker: Narrator

text: then her former husband who sent her away is not allowed to take her again to be his wife, after she has been defiled; for that is an abomination before the Lord, and you shall not bring sin on the land which the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When a man takes a new wife, he is not to go out with the army, nor be assigned any duty; he shall be free at home for one year and shall make his wife whom he has taken happy.
speaker: Narrator

text: “No one shall seize a handmill or an upper millstone as a pledge for a loan, since he would be seizing the debtor’s means of life as a pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If someone is caught kidnapping any of his countrymen of the sons of Israel, and he treats him as merchandise and sells him, then that thief shall die; so you shall eliminate the evil from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Be careful about an infestation of leprosy, that you are very attentive and act in accordance with everything that the Levitical priests teach you; just as I have commanded them, you shall be careful to act.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember what the Lord your God did to Miriam on the way as you came out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you make your neighbor a loan of any kind, you shall not enter his house to take his pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall stand outside, and the person to whom you are making the loan shall bring the pledge outside to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he is a poor man, you shall not sleep with his pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the sun goes down you shall certainly return the pledge to him, so that he may sleep in his cloak and bless you; and it will be righteousness for you before the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not exploit a hired worker who is poor and needy, whether he is one of your countrymen or one of your strangers who are in your land in your towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall give him his wages on his day before the sun sets—for he is poor and sets his heart on it—so that he does not cry out against you to the Lord, and it becomes a sin in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Fathers shall not be put to death for their sons, nor shall sons be put to death for their fathers; everyone shall be put to death for his own sin alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not pervert the justice due a stranger or an orphan, nor seize a widow’s garment as a pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you are to remember that you were a slave in Egypt, and that the Lord your God redeemed you from there; therefore I am commanding you to do this thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you reap your harvest in your field and forget a sheaf in the field, you are not to go back to get it; it shall belong to the stranger, the orphan, and to the widow, in order that the Lord your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you beat the olives off your olive tree, you are not to search through the branches again; that shall be left for the stranger, the orphan, and for the widow.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you gather the grapes of your vineyard, you are not to go over it again; that shall be left for the stranger, the orphan, and the widow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt; therefore I am commanding you to do this thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If there is a dispute between people and they go to court, and the judges decide their case, and they declare the righteous innocent and pronounce the wicked guilty,
speaker: Narrator

text: then it shall be if the wicked person deserves to be beaten, the judge shall then make him lie down and have him beaten in his presence with the number of lashes according to his wrongful act.
speaker: Narrator

text: He may have him beaten forty times, but not more, so that he does not have him beaten with many more lashes than these, and that your brother does not become contemptible in your eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not muzzle the ox while it is threshing.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When brothers live together, and one of them dies and has no son, the wife of the deceased shall not be married outside the family to a strange man. Her husband’s brother shall have relations with her and take her to himself as his wife, and perform the duty of a husband’s brother to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall then be that the firstborn to whom she gives birth shall assume the name of his father’s deceased brother, so that his name will not be wiped out from Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the man does not desire to take his brother’s widow, then his brother’s widow shall go up to the gate to the elders, and say, ‘My husband’s brother refuses to establish a name for his brother in Israel; he is not willing to perform the duty of a husband’s brother to me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the elders of his city shall summon him and speak to him. And if he persists and says, ‘I do not desire to take her,’
speaker: Narrator

text: then his brother’s widow shall come up to him in the sight of the elders, and pull his sandal off his foot and spit in his face; and she shall declare, ‘This is what is done to the man who does not build up his brother’s house!’
speaker: Narrator

text: And in Israel his family shall be called by the name, ‘The house of him whose sandal was removed.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “If two men, a man and his countryman, have a fight with each other, and the wife of one comes up to save her husband from the hand of the one who is hitting him, and she reaches out with her hand and grasps that man’s genitals,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall cut off her hand; you shall not show pity.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not have in your bag differing weights, a large and a small.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not have in your house differing measures, a large and a small.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall have a correct and honest weight; you shall have a correct and honest measure, so that your days may be prolonged in the land which the Lord your God is giving you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For everyone who does these things, everyone who acts unjustly is an abomination to the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Remember what Amalek did to you on the way when you came out of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: how he confronted you on the way and attacked among you all the stragglers at your rear when you were tired and weary; and he did not fear God.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it shall come about, when the Lord your God has given you rest from all your surrounding enemies in the land which the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance to possess, that you shall wipe out the mention of the name Amalek from under heaven; you must not forget.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then it shall be, when you enter the land which the Lord your God is giving you as an inheritance, and you take possession of it and live in it,
speaker: Narrator

text: that you shall take some of the first of all the produce of the ground which you bring in from your land that the Lord your God gives you, and you shall put it in a basket and go to the place where the Lord your God chooses to establish His name.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall go to the priest who is in office at that time and say to him, ‘I declare today to the Lord my God that I have entered the land which the Lord swore to our fathers to give us.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest shall take the basket from your hand and set it before the altar of the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall respond and say before the Lord your God, ‘My father was a wandering Aramean, and he went down to Egypt and resided there, few in number; but there he became a great, mighty, and populous nation.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Egyptians treated us badly and oppressed us, and imposed hard labor on us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we cried out to the Lord, the God of our fathers, and the Lord heard our voice and saw our wretched condition, our trouble, and our oppression;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Lord brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand, an outstretched arm, and with great terror, and with signs and wonders;
speaker: Narrator

text: and He has brought us to this place, and has given us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now behold, I have brought the first of the produce of the ground which You, Lord have given me.’ Then you shall set it before the Lord your God, and worship before the Lord your God;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you, the Levite, and the stranger who is among you shall rejoice in all the good which the Lord your God has given you and your household.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you have finished paying all the tithe of your produce in the third year, the year of the tithe, then you shall give it to the Levite, to the stranger, to the orphan, and to the widow, so that they may eat in your towns and be satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall say before the Lord your God, ‘I have removed the sacred portion from my house, and have also given it to the Levite, the stranger, the orphan, and the widow, in accordance with all Your commandments which You have commanded me; I have not violated or forgotten any of Your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not eaten of it while mourning, nor have I removed any of it while I was unclean, nor offered any of it to the dead. I have listened to the voice of the Lord my God; I have acted in accordance with everything that You have commanded me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look down from Your holy dwelling place, from heaven, and bless Your people Israel, and the ground which You have given us, a land flowing with milk and honey just as You swore to our fathers.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “This day the Lord your God commands you to perform these statutes and ordinances. Therefore you shall be careful to perform them with all your heart and with all your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Today you have declared the Lord to be your God, and that you will walk in His ways and keep His statutes, His commandments, and His ordinances, and listen to His voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord has today declared you to be His people, His personal possession, just as He promised you, and that you are to keep all His commandments;
speaker: Narrator

text: and that He will put you high above all the nations which He has made, for glory, fame, and honor; and that you shall be a consecrated people to the Lord your God, just as He has spoken.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and the elders of Israel commanded the people, saying, “Keep all the commandments which I am commanding you today.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it shall be on the day when you cross the Jordan to the land which the Lord your God is giving you, that you shall set up for yourself large stones and coat them with lime
speaker: Narrator

text: and write on them all the words of this Law, when you cross over, so that you may enter the land which the Lord your God is giving you, a land flowing with milk and honey, just as the Lord, the God of your fathers, promised you.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it shall be when you cross the Jordan, you shall set up these stones on Mount Ebal, as I am commanding you today, and you shall coat them with lime.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, you shall build there an altar to the Lord your God, an altar of stones; you shall not wield an iron tool on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall build the altar of the Lord your God of uncut stones, and you shall offer on it burnt offerings to the Lord your God;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall sacrifice peace offerings and eat there, and rejoice before the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall write on the stones all the words of this Law very clearly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and the Levitical priests spoke to all Israel, saying, “Be silent and listen, Israel! This day you have become a people for the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall obey the Lord your God, and do His commandments and His statutes which I am commanding you today.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses also commanded the people on that day, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you cross the Jordan, these tribes shall stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the curse, these tribes shall stand on Mount Ebal: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites shall then respond and say to all the people of Israel with a loud voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed is the person who makes a carved image or cast metal image, an abomination to the Lord, the work of the hands of a craftsman, and sets it up in secret.’ And all the people shall reply and say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed is one who treats his father or mother contemptuously.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed is one who displaces his neighbor’s boundary marker.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed is one who misleads a person who is blind on the road.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed is one who distorts the justice due a stranger, an orphan, or a widow.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed is he who sleeps with his father’s wife, because he has uncovered his father’s garment.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed is one who has sexual intercourse with any animal.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed is he who sleeps with his sister, the daughter of his father or of his mother.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed is he who sleeps with his mother-in-law.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed is he who attacks his neighbor in secret.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed is he who accepts a bribe to attack an innocent person.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed is anyone who does not fulfill the words of this Law by doing them.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now it shall be, if you diligently obey the Lord your God, being careful to do all His commandments which I am commanding you today, that the Lord your God will put you high above all the nations of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all these blessings will come to you and reach you if you obey the Lord your God:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Blessed will you be in the city, and blessed will you be in the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Blessed will be the children of your womb, the produce of your ground, and the offspring of your animals: the newborn of your herd and the young of your flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Blessed will be your basket and your kneading bowl.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Blessed will you be when you come in, and blessed will you be when you go out.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Lord will cause your enemies who rise up against you to be defeated by you; they will go out against you one way and will flee at your presence seven ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will command the blessing for you in your barns and in everything that you put your hand to, and He will bless you in the land that the Lord your God is giving you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will establish you as a holy people to Himself, as He swore to you, if you keep the commandments of the Lord your God and walk in His ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the peoples of the earth will see that you are called by the name of the Lord, and they will be afraid of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord will give you more than enough prosperity, in the children of your womb, in the offspring of your livestock, and in the produce of your ground, in the land which the Lord swore to your fathers to give you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will open for you His good storehouse, the heavens, to give rain to your land in its season and to bless every work of your hand; and you will lend to many nations, but you will not borrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord will make you the head and not the tail, and you will only be above, and not be underneath, if you listen to the commandments of the Lord your God which I am commanding you today, to follow them carefully,
speaker: Narrator

text: and do not turn aside from any of the words which I am commanding you today, to the right or the left, to pursue other gods to serve them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But it shall come about, if you do not obey the Lord your God, to be careful to follow all His commandments and His statutes which I am commanding you today, that all these curses will come upon you and overtake you:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Cursed will you be in the city, and cursed will you be in the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Cursed will be your basket and your kneading bowl.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Cursed will be the children of your womb, the produce of your ground, the newborn of your herd, and the offspring of your flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Cursed will you be when you come in, and cursed will you be when you go out.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Lord will send against you curses, panic, and rebuke, in everything you undertake to do, until you are destroyed and until you perish quickly, on account of the evil of your deeds, because you have abandoned Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will make the plague cling to you until He has eliminated you from the land where you are entering to take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will strike you with consumption, inflammation, fever, feverish heat, and with the sword, with blight, and with mildew, and they will pursue you until you perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heaven which is over your head shall be bronze, and the earth which is under you, iron.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will make the rain of your land powder and dust; from heaven it shall come down on you until you are destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Lord will cause you to be defeated by your enemies; you will go out one way against them, but you will flee seven ways from their presence, and you will be an example of terror to all the kingdoms of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your dead bodies will serve as food for all birds of the sky and for the animals of the earth, and there will be no one to frighten them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Lord will strike you with the boils of Egypt and with tumors, the festering rash, and with scabies, from which you cannot be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will strike you with insanity, blindness, and with confusion of mind;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you will be groping about at noon, just as a person who is blind gropes in the darkness, and you will not be successful in your ways; but you will only be oppressed and robbed all the time, with no one to save you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will betroth a woman, but another man will violate her; you will build a house, but you will not live in it; you will plant a vineyard, but you will not make use of its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your ox will be slaughtered before your eyes, but you will not eat of it; your donkey will be snatched away from you, and will not be restored to you; your sheep will be given to your enemies, and you will have no one to save you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your sons and your daughters will be given to another people, while your eyes look on and long for them constantly; but there will be nothing you can do.
speaker: Narrator

text: A people whom you do not know will eat the produce of your ground and every product of your labor, and you will never be anything but oppressed and mistreated continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will also be driven insane by the sight of what you see.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will strike you on the knees and thighs with severe boils from which you cannot be healed, and strike you from the sole of your foot to the top of your head.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will bring you and your king, whom you appoint over you, to a nation that neither you nor your fathers have known, and there you shall serve other gods, made of wood and stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will become an object of horror, a song of mockery, and an object of taunting among all the peoples where the Lord drives you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You will bring out a great amount of seed to the field, but you will gather in little, because the locust will devour it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will plant and cultivate vineyards, but you will neither drink of the wine nor bring in the harvest, because the worm will eat it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will have olive trees throughout your territory but you will not anoint yourself with the oil, because your olives will drop off prematurely.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will father sons and daughters but they will not remain yours, because they will go into captivity.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cricket will take possession of all your trees and the produce of your ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: The stranger who is among you will rise above you higher and higher, and you will go down lower and lower.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will lend to you, but you will not lend to him; he will be the head, and you will be the tail.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So all these curses shall come upon you and pursue you and overtake you until you are destroyed, because you would not obey the Lord your God by keeping His commandments and His statutes which He commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will become a sign and a wonder against you and your descendants forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Since you did not serve the Lord your God with joy and a cheerful heart, in gratitude for the abundance of all things,
speaker: Narrator

text: you will serve your enemies whom the Lord will send against you, in hunger, thirst, nakedness, and devoid of all things; and He will put an iron yoke on your neck until He has destroyed you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Lord will bring a nation against you from far away, from the end of the earth, as the eagle swoops down; a nation whose language you will not understand,
speaker: Narrator

text: a nation with a defiant attitude, who will have no respect for the old, nor show favor to the young.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore, it will eat the offspring of your herd and the produce of your ground until you are destroyed; a nation that will leave you no grain, new wine, or oil, nor the newborn of your cattle or the young of your flock, until they have eliminated you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it will besiege you in all your towns until your high and fortified walls in which you trusted come down throughout your land, and it will besiege you in all your towns throughout your land which the Lord your God has given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you will eat the offspring of your own body, the flesh of your sons and of your daughters whom the Lord your God has given you, during the siege and the hardship by which your enemy will oppress you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man who is refined and very delicate among you will be hostile toward his brother, toward the wife he cherishes, and toward the rest of his children who are left,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that he will not give even one of them any of the flesh of his children which he will eat, since he has nothing else left, during the siege and the hardship by which your enemy will oppress you in all your towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: The refined and delicate woman among you, who would not venture to set the sole of her foot on the ground because of her delicateness and tenderness, will be hostile toward the husband she cherishes and toward her son and daughter,
speaker: Narrator

text: and toward her afterbirth that comes from between her legs, and toward her children to whom she gives birth, because she will eat them secretly for lack of anything else, during the siege and the hardship with which your enemy will oppress you in your towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If you are not careful to follow all the words of this Law that are written in this book, to fear this honored and awesome name, the Lord your God,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the Lord will bring extraordinary plagues on you and your descendants, severe and lasting plagues, and miserable and chronic sicknesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He will bring back on you every disease of Egypt of which you were afraid, and they will cling to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also every sickness and every plague, which are not written in the book of this Law, the Lord will bring on you until you are destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you will be left few in number, whereas you were as numerous as the stars of heaven, because you did not obey the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it will come about that, just as the Lord rejoiced over you to be good to you, and make you numerous, so will the Lord rejoice over you to wipe you out and destroy you; and you will be torn away from the land which you are entering to possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore, the Lord will scatter you among all the peoples, from one end of the earth to the other; and there you will serve other gods, made of wood and stone, which you and your fathers have not known.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among those nations you will find no peace, and there will be no resting place for the sole of your foot; but there the Lord will give you a trembling heart, failing of eyes, and despair of soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: So your lives will be hanging in doubt before you; and you will be terrified night and day, and have no assurance of your life.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning you will say, ‘If only it were evening!’ And at evening you will say, ‘If only it were morning!’ because of the terror of your heart which you fear, and the sight of your eyes which you will see.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord will bring you back to Egypt in ships, by the way about which I said to you, ‘You will never see it again!’ And there you will offer yourselves for sale to your enemies as male and female slaves, but there will be no buyer.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the words of the covenant which the Lord commanded Moses to make with the sons of Israel in the land of Moab, besides the covenant which He had made with them at Horeb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses summoned all Israel and said to them, “You have seen all that the Lord did before your eyes in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh and all his servants, and to all his land;
speaker: Narrator

text: the great trials which your eyes have seen, those great signs and wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet to this day the Lord has not given you a heart to know, nor eyes to see, nor ears to hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have led you in the wilderness for forty years; your clothes have not worn out on you, and your sandal has not worn out on your foot.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have not eaten bread, nor have you drunk wine or other strong drink, in order that you might know that I am the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you reached this place, Sihon the king of Heshbon and Og the king of Bashan came out to meet us for battle, but we defeated them;
speaker: Narrator

text: and we took their land and gave it as an inheritance to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of the Manassites.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you will keep the words of this covenant and do them, in order that you may be successful in everything that you do.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You stand today, all of you, before the Lord your God: your heads, your tribes, your elders and your officers, that is, all the men of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: your little ones, your wives, and the stranger who is within your camps, from the one who gathers your firewood to the one who draws your water,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you may enter into the covenant with the Lord your God, and into His oath which the Lord your God is making with you today,
speaker: Narrator

text: in order that He may establish you today as His people, and that He may be your God, just as He spoke to you and as He swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now it is not with you alone that I am making this covenant and this oath,
speaker: Narrator

text: but both with those who stand here with us today in the presence of the Lord our God, and with those who are not with us here today
speaker: Narrator

text: (for you know how we lived in the land of Egypt, and how we passed through the midst of the nations through which you passed;
speaker: Narrator

text: moreover, you have seen their abominations and their idols made of wood and stone, silver and gold, which they had with them);
speaker: Narrator

text: so that there will not be among you a man or woman, or family or tribe, whose heart turns away today from the Lord our God, to go to serve the gods of those nations; that there will not be among you a root bearing poisonous fruit and wormwood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be when he hears the words of this curse, that he will consider himself fortunate in his heart, saying, ‘I will do well though I walk in the stubbornness of my heart in order to destroy the watered land along with the dry.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will not be willing to forgive him, but rather the anger of the Lord and His wrath will burn against that person, and every curse that is written in this book will lie upon him, and the Lord will wipe out his name from under heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord will single him out for disaster from all the tribes of Israel, in accordance with all the curses of the covenant which is written in this Book of the Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now the future generation, your sons who rise up after you and the foreigner who comes from a distant land, when they see the plagues of that land and the diseases with which the Lord has afflicted it, will say,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘All its land is brimstone and salt, burned debris, unsown and unproductive, and no grass grows on it, like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which the Lord overthrew in His anger and in His wrath.’
speaker: Narrator

text: All the nations will say, ‘Why has the Lord done all this to this land? Why this great outburst of anger?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then people will say, ‘It is because they abandoned the covenant of the Lord, the God of their fathers, which He made with them when He brought them out of the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went and served other gods and worshiped them, gods that they have not known and whom He had not assigned to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, the anger of the Lord burned against that land, to bring upon it every curse which is written in this book;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Lord uprooted them from their land in anger, fury, and in great wrath, and hurled them into another land, as it is this day.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “The secret things belong to the Lord our God, but the things revealed belong to us and to our sons forever, so that we may follow all the words of this Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So it will be when all of these things have come upon you, the blessing and the curse which I have placed before you, and you call them to mind in all the nations where the Lord your God has scattered you,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you return to the Lord your God and obey Him with all your heart and soul in accordance with everything that I am commanding you today, you and your sons,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the Lord your God will restore you from captivity, and have compassion on you, and will gather you again from all the peoples where the Lord your God has scattered you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any of your scattered countrymen are at the ends of the earth, from there the Lord your God will gather you, and from there He will bring you back.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord your God will bring you into the land which your fathers possessed, and you shall possess it; and He will be good to you and make you more numerous than your fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Moreover, the Lord your God will circumcise your heart and the hearts of your descendants, to love the Lord your God with all your heart and all your soul, so that you may live.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord your God will inflict all these curses on your enemies and on those who hate you, who persecuted you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will again obey the Lord, and follow all His commandments which I am commanding you today.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord your God will prosper you abundantly in every work of your hand, in the children of your womb, the offspring of your cattle, and in the produce of your ground, for the Lord will again rejoice over you for good, just as He rejoiced over your fathers;
speaker: Narrator

text: if you obey the Lord your God, to keep His commandments and His statutes which are written in this Book of the Law, if you turn to the Lord your God with all your heart and soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: “For this commandment which I am commanding you today is not too difficult for you, nor is it far away.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is not in heaven, that you could say, ‘Who will go up to heaven for us and get it for us, and proclaim it to us, so that we may follow it?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Nor is it beyond the sea, that you could say, ‘Who will cross the sea for us and get it for us and proclaim it to us, so that we may follow it?’
speaker: Narrator

text: On the contrary, the word is very near you, in your mouth and in your heart, that you may follow it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “See, I have placed before you today life and happiness, and death and adversity,
speaker: Narrator

text: in that I am commanding you today to love the Lord your God, to walk in His ways and to keep His commandments, His statutes, and His judgments, so that you may live and become numerous, and that the Lord your God may bless you in the land where you are entering to take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if your heart turns away and you will not obey, but allow yourself to be led astray and you worship other gods and serve them,
speaker: Narrator

text: I declare to you today that you will certainly perish. You will not prolong your days in the land where you are crossing the Jordan to enter and take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I call heaven and earth to witness against you today, that I have placed before you life and death, the blessing and the curse. So choose life in order that you may live, you and your descendants,
speaker: Narrator

text: by loving the Lord your God, by obeying His voice, and by holding close to Him; for this is your life and the length of your days, so that you may live in the land which the Lord swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses went and spoke these words to all Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “I am 120 years old today; I am no longer able to go out and come in, and the Lord has told me, ‘You shall not cross this Jordan.’
speaker: Narrator

text: It is the Lord your God who is going to cross ahead of you; He Himself will destroy these nations before you, and you shall dispossess them. Joshua is the one who is going to cross ahead of you, just as the Lord has spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord will do to them just as He did to Sihon and Og, the kings of the Amorites, and to their land, when He destroyed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will turn them over to you, and you will do to them in accordance with all the commandments which I have commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be strong and courageous, do not be afraid or in dread of them, for the Lord your God is the One who is going with you. He will not desert you or abandon you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses called to Joshua and said to him in the sight of all Israel, “Be strong and courageous, for you will go with this people into the land which the Lord has sworn to their fathers to give them, and you will give it to them as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord is the one who is going ahead of you; He will be with you. He will not desert you or abandon you. Do not fear and do not be dismayed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses wrote this Law and gave it to the priests, the sons of Levi who carried the ark of the covenant of the Lord, and to all the elders of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses commanded them, saying, “At the end of every seven years, at the time of the year of the release of debts, at the Feast of Booths,
speaker: Narrator

text: when all Israel comes to appear before the Lord your God at the place which He will choose, you shall read this Law before all Israel so that they hear it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Assemble the people, the men, the women, the children, and the stranger who is in your town, so that they may hear and learn and fear the Lord your God, and be careful to follow all the words of this Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their children, who have not known, will hear and learn to fear the Lord your God, as long as you live on the land which you are about to cross the Jordan to possess.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Behold, the time for you to die is near; call Joshua and present yourselves at the tent of meeting, and I will commission him.” So Moses and Joshua went and presented themselves at the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord appeared in the tent in a pillar of cloud, and the pillar of cloud stood at the entrance of the tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Behold, you are about to lie down with your fathers; and this people will arise and play the prostitute with the foreign gods of the land into the midst of which they are going, and they will abandon Me and break My covenant which I have made with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then My anger will be kindled against them on that day, and I will abandon them and hide My face from them, and they will be consumed, and many evils and troubles will find them; so they will say on that day, ‘Is it not because our God is not among us that these evils have found us?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will assuredly hide My face on that day because of all the evil that they will have done, for they will have turned away to other gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now then, write this song for yourselves, and teach it to the sons of Israel; put it on their lips, so that this song may be a witness for Me against the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when I bring them into the land flowing with milk and honey, which I swore to their fathers, and they eat and are satisfied and become prosperous, then they will turn to other gods and serve them, and spurn Me and break My covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it will come about, when many evils and troubles find them, that this song will testify before them as a witness (for it shall not be forgotten from the mouth of their descendants); for I know their inclination which they are developing today, before I bring them into the land which I swore.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses wrote down this song on the same day, and taught it to the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He commissioned Joshua the son of Nun, and said, “Be strong and courageous, for you will bring the sons of Israel into the land which I swore to them, and I will be with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: It came about, when Moses finished writing the words of this Law in a book until they were complete,
speaker: Narrator

text: that Moses commanded the Levites who carried the ark of the covenant of the Lord, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take this Book of the Law and place it beside the ark of the covenant of the Lord your God, so that it may remain there as a witness against you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know your rebellion and your stubbornness; behold, as long as I have been alive with you until today, you have been rebellious against the Lord; how much more, then, after my death?
speaker: Narrator

text: Assemble to me all the elders of your tribes and your officers, that I may speak these words in their hearing and call the heavens and the earth as witnesses against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know that after my death you will behave very corruptly and turn from the way which I have commanded you; and evil will confront you in the latter days, because you will do that which is evil in the sight of the Lord, provoking Him to anger with the work of your hands.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses spoke in the hearing of all the assembly of Israel the words of this song, until they were complete:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Listen, you heavens, and I will speak;
And let the earth hear the words of my mouth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May my teaching drip as the rain,
My speech trickle as the dew,
As droplets on the fresh grass,
And as the showers on the vegetation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I proclaim the name of the Lord;
Ascribe greatness to our God!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Rock! His work is perfect,
For all His ways are just;
A God of faithfulness and without injustice,
Righteous and just is He.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Is this what you do to the Lord,
You foolish and unwise people?
Is He not your Father who has purchased you?
He has made you and established you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember the days of old,
Consider the years of all generations.
Ask your father and he will inform you,
Your elders, and they will tell you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the Most High gave the nations their inheritance,
When He separated the sons of mankind,
He set the boundaries of the peoples
According to the number of the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord’s portion is His people;
Jacob is the allotment of His inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He found him in a desert land,
And in the howling wasteland of a wilderness;
He encircled him, He cared for him,
He guarded him as the apple of His eye.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As an eagle stirs up its nest,
And hovers over its young,
He spread His wings, He caught them,
He carried them on His pinions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord alone guided him,
And there was no foreign god with him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He had him ride on the high places of the earth,
And he ate the produce of the field;
And He had him suck honey from the rock,
And oil from the flinty rock,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Curds of the herd, and milk of the flock,
With fat of lambs
And rams, the breed of Bashan, and of goats,
With the best of the wheat;
And you drank wine of the blood of grapes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“But Jeshurun became fat and kicked—
You have become fat, thick, and obstinate—
Then he abandoned God who made him,
And rejected the Rock of his salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They made Him jealous with strange gods;
With abominations they provoked Him to anger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They sacrificed to demons, who were not God,
To gods whom they have not known,
New gods who came lately,
Whom your fathers did not know.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You forgot the Rock who fathered you,
And forgot the God who gave you birth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“The Lord saw this, and spurned them
Because of the provocation by His sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then He said, ‘I will hide My face from them,
I will see what their end will be;
For they are a perverse generation,
Sons in whom there is no faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For a fire has flared in My anger,
And it burns to the lowest part of Sheol,
And devours the earth with its yield,
And sets on fire the foundations of the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘I will add misfortunes to them;
I will use up My arrows on them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will be wasted by famine, and emaciated by plague
And a bitter epidemic;
And the teeth of beasts I will send against them,
With the venom of crawling things of the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Outside the sword will make them childless,
And inside, terror—
Both young man and virgin,
The nursing child with the man of gray hair.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I would have said, “I will wipe them out,
I will remove the mention of their name from humanity,”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Had I not feared the provocation by the enemy,
That their adversaries would misjudge,
That they would say, “Our hand is triumphant,
And the Lord has not performed all this.”’
speaker: Narrator

text:
“For they are a nation destitute of counsel,
And there is no understanding in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If only they were wise and they understood this;
If only they would discern their future!
speaker: Narrator

text:
How could one chase a thousand,
And two put ten thousand to flight,
Unless their Rock had sold them,
And the Lord had given them up?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, their rock is not like our Rock;
Even our enemies themselves judge this.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For their vine is from the vine of Sodom,
And from the fields of Gomorrah;
Their grapes are grapes of poison,
Their clusters, bitter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their wine is the venom of serpents,
And the deadly poison of vipers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Is it not stored up with Me,
Sealed up in My treasuries?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Vengeance is Mine, and retribution;
In due time their foot will slip.
For the day of their disaster is near,
And the impending things are hurrying to them.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord will vindicate His people,
And will have compassion on His servants,
When He sees that their strength is gone,
And there is none remaining, bond or free.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And He will say, ‘Where are their gods,
The rock in which they took refuge?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who ate the fat of their sacrifices,
And drank the wine of their drink offering?
Let them rise up and help you,
Let them be your protection!
speaker: Narrator

text:
See now that I, I am He,
And there is no god besides Me;
It is I who put to death and give life.
I have wounded and it is I who heal,
And there is no one who can save anyone from My hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, I raise My hand to heaven,
And say, as I live forever,
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I have sharpened My flashing sword,
And My hand has taken hold of justice,
I will return vengeance on My adversaries,
And I will repay those who hate Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will make My arrows drunk with blood,
And My sword will devour flesh,
With the blood of the slain and the captives,
From the long-haired leaders of the enemy.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rejoice, you nations, with His people;
For He will avenge the blood of His servants,
And will return vengeance on His adversaries,
And will atone for His land and His people.”
speaker: Narrator
